item.title: Aria's Sphere
item.description: The Problem I kicked this problem around in my head for a few days. The “correct” way to solve it was to use multivariable calculus–which I have not yet learned. Still, I felt like there was some way to understand this problem without calculus. I was focused mostly on the parts not present in “Aria’s Sphere.” The four caps left over after cutting the square out are the complement of the surface area of the entire sphere, whose volume can be known by \( 4\pi r^2 \).
